intro: Juncus acutus var. decompositus, commonly known as the decomposed rush, is a variant of the common rush species. It is a perennial plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. The plant produces tall, slender cylindrical stems that are often covered in a layer of decomposed organic material, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it typically grows in shallow water or moist soil. This plant plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various small organisms.
